comments:
Build ID: 1.0.0.20070928-1625 and 1.0.0.20070817-1525

Steps To Reproduce:
1. A RAP based application launched within Eclipse, works fine.
2. Try to export the application and launch it from command line as an OSGi application. Activating the RAP UI  bundle causes an exception. See the stacktrace:

(In reply to comment #0)
I get the same error, same circumstances.  When I run the example RAP application in Eclipse it runs properly.  When I run in a standalone app, I get NoClassDefFoundError: SaxEception

HOWEVER, I also get this same behavior (works in Eclipse, fails in standalone app) when I run a Jetty + Equinox app WITHOUT ANY RAP in it at all (I am trying Wicket instead of RAP).  My active bundles and my stack trace below.  I looked carefully the version of at each bundle run by the Eclipse runtime versus that deployed in my standalone app, and they match up.  I also checked diag [bundle number] for each bundle, and get "No unresolved constraints." for each.

(In reply to comment #0)
I was able to bypass this error by adding this to my bundle's MANIFEST.MF under Import-Package: 

 javax.xml.parsers,
 org.xml.sax,
 org.xml.sax.ext,
 org.xml.sax.helpers
